description: Photographer Rachel Adams has been commissioned to create an exhibition capturing Croydon's iconic architecture & portraits of the people who look after these buildings, such as cleaners, concierge, security guards. The exhibition will be held here, at the Croydon Clocktower atrium & also at the Croydon Urban Room, located in the Whitgift Shopping Centre. For more information on visiting this exhibition at the Croydon Urban Room, head here: https://programme.openhouse.org.uk/listings/12687

factsheet.heading: About
paragraphs: 'Croydon Unlocked' is an exhibition by artist and photographer Rachel Adams which explores a selection of Croydon's best loved buildings - including Electric House, Croydon Airport, South Norwood Library, Apollo House, and more - and the people who care for them. The exhibition is accompanied by a text by Croydon-born author, John Grindrod.

The exhibition opens on Saturday 14 September across 2 venues: Croydon Clocktower and Croydon Urban Room. Please refer to Croydon Urban Room's listing for further details on visiting the exhibition there.

There will also be an exhibition talk at the Braithwaite Hall, in Croydon Town Hall, with Rachel Adams and John Grindrod on the opening day, Saturday 14 September. Please refer to the listing for details. Booking for this event is essential.

name: Croydon Unlocked
